article.headline: Morgan Stanley to acquire Eaton Vance in cash-and-stock deal with equity value of about $7 billion
article.body: Morgan Stanley MS, -0.34% said Thursday it has agreed to acquire asset manager Eaton Vance Corp. EV, -0.56% in a cash-and-stock deal with an equity value of about $7 billion. The deal will boost Morgan Stanley Investment Management to a firm with about $1.2 trillion of assets under management and more than $5 billion in combined revenue. "Eaton Vance is a perfect fit for Morgan Stanley," said James P. Gorman, chief executive of Morgan Stanley. Under the terms of the deal, Eaton Vance shareholders will receive $28.25 per share in cash and 0.5833x of Morgan Stanley common stock, for a total consideration of $56.50 per share. The deal is expected to close in the second quarter of 2021, to be breakeven for per-share earnings immediately and marginally accretive over time. Eaton Vance shares soared 44% premarket on the news, while Morgan Stanley stock fell 0.7%.
